page.title: 18RELIGION IN CHAGFORD
page.content: There are{4}types of{Churches}in Chagford. These are{St. Michael's, {(C. of E.), the Roman Catholic Church, {the Ebeneezer Gospel Hall and the {Methodist Church.}The oldest of these is St. Michael's, which was consecrat_ ed in 1261 and of which most appears to have been built in the 15th Cent_ ury. Of the four, it has the largest congregation and establishes close links with the local{Primary School.} The Rector also has responsibility for {Holy Trinity, Gidleigh}and{St.Mary the {Virgin, Throwleigh.} To assist him in this onerous task retired Clergy take services on Sunday in St. Michael's when necessary. The Church receives many visitors throughout the year who appreciate its beauty, in particular the carved{rood screen.}The Churchyard gravestones record the passing of many generations of local families.
